content.webTitle: Glaxo halts trial of Aids drug after liver problems

fields.headline: Glaxo halts trial of Aids drug after liver problems
fields.bodyText: GlaxoSmithKline's next-generation Aids drug suffered a setback after two patients in trials developed liver problems. Glaxo has halted mid-stage tests in patients who have not taken Aids drugs before but late-stage trials in people who have taken other HIV drugs are continuing. "We don't know whether the [problems] are drug related, but given the serious nature of the issue, we are halting the programme," a Glaxo spokesman said. The news puts the UK's largest drugs firm further behind its US rival Pfizer in the race to develop the Aids treatments, known as CCR5 inhibitors.
